public ResponseEntity<String> editPrintShopReview(@PathVariable("printShopId") long printShopId, @PathVariable("reviewId") long reviewId, Principal principal, WebRequest request)
```

And the method body:

```

The method uses:

2. A `Principal` parameter (for authentication)
3. A `WebRequest` parameter to get query parameters "review" and "rating"

message.content:
Based on my analysis of the code, I can now identify the parameters for the PUT endpoint `/printshops/{printShopId}/reviews/{reviewId}`:

1. Path parameters:
   - `printShopId`: The ID of the print shop (from @PathVariable)
   - `reviewId`: The ID of the review (from @PathVariable)

2. Query parameters (extracted from WebRequest):
   - `review`: The review text/description
   - `rating`: The rating value (integer)

The method uses `request.getParameter("review")` and `request.getParameter("rating")` to extract these values from the request.

Now I'll generate the Parameter Objects in Swagger 2.0 format:

    "name": "printShopId",
    "in": "path",

    "format": "int64"
  },
  {
    "name": "reviewId",
    "in": "path",
    "description": "The ID of the review",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int64"
  },
  {
    "name": "review",
    "in": "query",
    "description": "The review text/description",
    "required": true,
    "type": "string"
  },
  {
    "name": "rating",
    "in": "query",

    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int32"
  }
]
